channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In the Age of AI, some tech leaders think communications degrees may actually be more valuable than computer science degrees
item.description: Can a two-year ‘problem-solving pool’ solve AI replacing entry-level jobs? This C-suite executive thinks so.

item.title: Kind’s billionaire founder says he still picks up pennies off the street because ‘ego is the only thing more powerful than greed’
item.description: Daniel Lubetzky's approach to humility was inspired by his grandfather, who was worked as a rancher in Mexico.

item.title: Keurig Dr Pepper, parent of Peet’s Coffee in $18 billion merger that essentially unwinds the marriage of hot and cold beverages from 2018
item.description: After the deal, the company will break itself in two, with one company selling coffee and the other selling cold beverages like Snapple, Dr Pepper, 7U...

item.title: Small biotech firm plans $400 million Solana purchase as crypto treasury trend spreads
item.description: But Multicoin, Galaxy Digital, and Jump Crypto are reportedly in the market to raise another $1 billion raise for another Solana treasury company.

item.title: Katherine LaNasa Earned Her Role in ‘The Pitt’ the Hard Way
item.description: The actress received an Emmy nod for her performance as a seasoned E.R. nurse, a woman who has seen it all and lived to keep fighting. So has LaNasa.

item.title: New Zealand has the best work-life balance in the world—here’s what works
item.description: Searching for better work-life balance in the U.S.? You likely won’t find it.

item.title: How China Influences Elections in America’s Biggest City
item.description: The Chinese consulate in Manhattan has mobilized community groups to defeat candidates who don’t fall in line with the authoritarian state.

item.title: Expecting on the Front Lines: Motherhood in Ukraine’s Military
item.description: Pregnant Ukrainian soldiers say they are fighting for the future of their country and for their children.

item.title: With Trump’s Takeover, Washington Finds a Mission to Resist
item.description: Known more for their museums, monuments and government buildings than their culture, Washingtonians are showing a spirit of dissent as protesters dog ...

item.title: Expecting on the Front Lines: Motherhood in Ukraine’s Military
item.description: Pregnant Ukrainian soldiers say they are fighting for the future of their country and for their children.

item.title: France Summons U.S. Ambassador Charles Kushner Over Antisemitism Comments
item.description: The new American envoy, Charles Kushner, said that France was not doing enough to protect its Jewish citizens, a charge the government in Paris said i...

item.title: How China Influences Elections in America’s Biggest City
item.description: The Chinese consulate in Manhattan has mobilized community groups to defeat candidates who don’t fall in line with the authoritarian state.

item.title: Four Journalists Among Those Killed in Israeli Strikes on Gaza Hospital, Officials Say
item.description: Gaza-based reporters said the four had worked for various international media outlets. The Israeli military confirmed its forces had struck the hospit...

item.title: What Does It Take to Get Men to See a Doctor?
item.description: Men in the U.S. live six fewer years than women. One clinic is trying to persuade men that getting checked out could save their life.

item.title: German Prosecutors Charge American With Attempted Spying for China
item.description: The authorities provided few details about the case, the latest in a series of apprehensions in Germany of potential Chinese spies.
